summary: This is a travel authorization email from the DOJ's E2 travel system, approving a trip for July 11-12, 2019, for the purpose of conducting victim interviews related to the case 'U.S. v. Epstein (2018R01618)'. It indicates ongoing investigative activity shortly before Epstein's arrest.

events.title: Approved Travel for Victim Interviews
events.description: A travel authorization is approved for a DOJ employee to conduct victim interviews related to the U.S. v. Epstein case.

keyFacts: A travel authorization was approved on July 10, 2019, for travel on July 11-12, 2019.
The purpose of the travel was for 'Victim Interviews' related to the federal case 'U.S. v. Epstein (2018R01618)'.
The document originates from the DOJ's internal E2 travel system, indicating official government investigation activity.
The timing (July 2019) is significant as it is just days before Jeffrey Epstein was arrested on July 6, 2019, suggesting preparatory or follow-up investigative work.
The destination is listed as related to the 'NEW YORK SOUTHERN' district, which is the jurisdiction handling the case.
